it is exploitative for men, and discriminatory too:

- Men get paid 66% of what women get paid to do porn.
- It requires the capability of the MAN to orgasm on cue.  99% of the time,
this is not faked.  A guy, to survive in that business must train himself
and be able to perform on command.  Do you know what that does to one's sex
life.  As for women, some screaming, a faked orgasm here and there, and if
you aren't really ready, there's always KY.  But for the most part, all you
have to do is be there for the camera.  Hard work...
- Men have a much shorter porn shelf life than the women (check the
expiration dates on some of these guys), AND once they are done, and choose
not to perform again, they must go out and make a living like everyone
else.  Do you think that jibes and barbs are only at women?  Do you think
any of these guys could ever go into mainstream business and become the CEO
of a very public company?
-  The guys in porn are basically machines that must be able to do any task
on cue.  They are automatons, whose sole purpose is to ejaculate in front
of the camera.

Yeah, and women are being exploited.  Please.  Exploitation is ALWAYS a
double edged sword.

People choose what they want.  As long as they do not interfere with my
right to life, liberty, and happiness, then to me, it's all good.  Making
porn is much better IMO, than all the Schwarzenbugger & Stallone movies.

someones head off with a bazooka.

We're all exploited.

At 01:03 AM 4/24/96 -0700, you wrote:
>Yeah!!! I ran into two cool vibe events in Sac this weekend so i 
>thought I'd share it with you-all.
>
>1st was a decent size 420 party at a really cool guys house.  About 50 
>or so people (I'm not a good estimator) and chill ambient grooves by 
>different local area dj's.  The whole thing felt like one big awesome 
>chill room at some Sf rave.  The vibe was laid back and friendly.  
>People were having a good time and i got to meet some groovy 
>individuals.  Talked with Rick from the list (about an hour long song 
>with a German name).  All in all I could see what might be the 
>foundation for a good scene in Sacramento.  At bigger parties too many 
>fronters and hommies get in the way of the vibe but at smaller "house" 
>events the energy gets concentrated and focused.  Hope to go to more 
>stuff like this in the near future!

I have to totally agree with Chris on this one.  My friend Russell organized
a great party.  It was for the most part all ambient. (which many of you
know just makes me so happy :) :) :)  A couple of the dj's that played were
getting thier first experience at playing in front of people, and everyone
did a great job.  Another friend of mine named Jonny (sp), spun an
incredible ambient set. He's rad cuz he's all over the place changing from
beats to ambient to world music and lots of crazy stuff, but the cool thing
about him is he makes it all flow together perfectly, which not everyone can
do.  The space, was Russell's front room, which had most of the furniture
removed except for the couch.  There was a futon matress or two on the floor
proped up against the wall, and many pillows.  The Turntables were set up
low on a coffee table type thing, and black lights lit the room.  There was
the most incredible black light painting hanging behind the dj that covered
the entire wall (about 12 feet square.  I was told by Russell that it was
painted by the same guy who does those painting for the Gathering.  It added
a really nice feel to the space.  The Sound system was perfect.  Totally
clean, really nice sound....and that is so important for ambient music.  And
last but not least, the people.  Totally cool, friendly people.  We all sat
in that same room, which wasn't very big, all night and it never felt crampt
or closed in.  The vibe was definately there.  I look forward to more
parties like this in the future, cuz they have a really personal feel to
them.  Like Chris said, the energy is more focused.

Rick

Amy,

> The rational, compassionate side of me agrees with you entirely.  But 
> there are some things in life that disgust me so greatly that it is 
> extremely difficult to get past it.  I've been flamed about TL before on 
	Ah, that must be when people have different sets of values than you do,
and are not ashamed of them, right?

> sfraves about a year ago, and my stance has still not changed.  Once a 
> person is so severly tainted, it is hard to wash off the stain.  Sad, 
	"Tainted", I see. By "dirty icky sex", right?

> Lords became a saint.  I would always see her as a washed up ex porn 
> queen who helped in degrading women.  Really, I do try and see the good 
	Really? She personally went around degrading individual women, one at a
time? Or are you talking about the _opinion_ that porn somehow degrades "all women
everywhere by objectifying them"? In that case you should have said "who in my
opinion helped degrade women". I, more than many people, would have a perfect
excuse to hate sex and sex-related "degradation" (and in fact I am virtually
asexual) after growing up abused, raped several times, etc. But I refuse to
take the "easy" way out and claim that "porn" or "prostitution" is the evil
rather than the people who are unable to handle it. How nice that you are willing
to support one "vice", exstacy, while denigrating and condemning another which
doesn't interest you. In both cases the problem is not the compound/activity but
rather the people who can not use it responsibly. As a sex worker and a woman who
has done porn, I have to object to your putting down whole industries on the
basis of questionable (and equally disputed) "research" and the results of a
minority of "users" who have problems.

	That said, I would still be happy to talk to you for a bit when/if we
run across each other at a rave (about this or just friendly chat, whatever),
I'm not mad at _you_, but rather the intolerance your writing indicates. Remember,
P, _L_, U, _R_...

				Marisa

I think the problem with trying to assess the character of celebrities is
that we usually don't know much about their private lives or about their
inner selves.  Some are easy to read, and others have infinitely more depth
and authenticity than we could ever imagine.  It's easy to see how opinions
are formed of some people when all we know of them is what they show to us
publicly.  I'd like to think that everyone has at least one redeeming
quality; even I have my honorable moments.

Sorry to take up the bandwidth,

- E

child.  If there was abuse, etc.   Well, I was raised opposite.  I was 
raised viewing sex as something not good and to even wait til you are 
married.  The whole sex industry is seen as bad(in the way I was raised) - 
run by people who didn't have any respect for themselves or others.  That 
has got to have an affect on a kid and how she sees her world.  I've gotten 
past alot - but all of your comments/flames still sit uneasily with me.  I 
can't change my mind just like that.  I'm sorry for those I have made angry, 
but I was being honest with how I felt - even if some of those opinions I 
had were made out of ignorance.  (I have no interest in reading porn 
biographies - I haven't the time)  And gee, thank you so very much for

good. :)

and "RE:" will be performing live ambient/idm as well as dj'ing the same
kinda stuff at Reed College in Portland, Oregon.  We will be doing a crazy
marathon 20 hour set starting Friday night and going to Saturday afternoon.
Then we will head over to the "Light Party" somewhere else in Portland for
another 4 hour set.  There are five of us in all so it will be a little
crazy, but it should be mega fun.  I think the space we will be playing in
is called the Black Lodge or something like that.  The event is some kind of
fair that will last all weekend.  I am also told there will be some sort of
rave area "techno tent."  I'm not sure if the event cost's any money.  Hope
to see some of you there.  Take it easy.

To: John Draper <crunch@well.com>
CC: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: Re:Gaia review-long-(was Sarvi!?!)
References: <199604241824.LAA21753@mh1.well.com>

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

> >
> Speaking of Gaia,  could someone PLEASE give a report?
> 
> I heard it was at Home Base...  How many people attended?  HOw was ths
> music?    Was it trance?  House?  HArdcore (wishful thinking)?
> 
> Crunchman

Well if you insist. The party was not at Home Base but rather
a huge warehouse nearby. I always become hesitant when I hear
"virgin warehouse", but to the best of knowledge this was the
first party thrown there. 

My friends and I got there about 11:15 and waited in line for less 
than 5 minutes, pretty cool. When you walked in there was a huge
foyer, with all the dealers, of course. To the right were two chill
rooms.

The first was a living room sized room full of couches. The floor
was covered with matresses. The adjoining room looked pretty trippy,
but that became the spot where someone sold nitris all night long.

The other chill room was much larger, also with couches, and a
fairly large sound system for that space.

As for the main dance floor...They had a giant Buddha behind the DJ
where the lasers shot over the dance floor. They had a row of several
large translucent pieces of cloth hanging from the ceiling that the 
laser shot through. Pretty interesting effect. The place was pretty
packed, it wasn't too hot, and our buddies Lyon security were pretty
much keeping to themselves.

I personally thought the vibe was great. I ran into a lot of my old
raver friends and met many new ones. Everyone seemed to be having a
good time.

As for the music, DJ Dan ripped it up again as usual, and I was
particularly impressed with Vicious Vic's set. I heard more breakbeat,
not as much trance, But a good mix of different styles. But then again 
I was bouncing around all over the place that night so I might have
missed something..

I don't know how many but there were tons of people there. The space 
was so big it never got too packed. I'd guess somewhere around a few 
thousand attended???

We left around 7am, when the place really started to thin out. I saw 
two cops as I left looking around but they didn't do anything.

All in all I feel it was a great party. Props to Full Circle for 
pulling this event off. PLUR
                                          Hugs,
                                           CT

Subject: gaia
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Date: Wed, 24 Apr 1996 13:53:48 -0700 (PDT)

*stuff deleted*
> Speaking of Gaia,  could someone PLEASE give a report?
> I heard it was at Home Base...  How many people attended?  HOw was ths
> music?    Was it trance?  House?  HArdcore (wishful thinking)?

well first of all, gaia was not at the home base location. it was at a
virgin warehouse located by the colusium bart station. the place was
absolutelly amazing. i think they did a great job of setting it up and
decorating it. it get's a bit difficult to decorate 64,000 sqft.  plus
they had some of the most amazing lasers i've seen to date. they had the
main room with most of the dj's performing in there. it was so big that
there was never a problem finding a place to dance. that i liked a lot.
they had a fair sized second room with the ameba boys in there and others.

as far as the ppl and the party itself were concerned...i was pleasently
surprised. =) i spent some time working the door for a while so i had a
chance to see a great deal of the ppl as they first walked in. it was nice
to see such a diverse crowd (esp. one of that size) be able to pull
together and create such a fun environment. the music of the nite had a
lil something for everyone. we got a delicious taste of everything from
house to a bit of electro to hard trance to breaks to acid. the highlight
for me was being able to hear micro and vicious vic after hearing so much
about them. they both played amazing sets. once agian, dan also played a
wonderful set. barry weaver started out with a strong set, but lost me
shortly into it.  in the end we were givin a wonderful -hard- closing set
by liquid. it was the perfect way to close out the evening. 

all in all i would have to say that this was one of the best parties that
i have seen in a while. full circle did a wonderful job with gaia.
everything seemed to fall into place nicely. if gaia was any indication of
things to come, then i look forward to the sankofa one yr on june 15th.
hoping that everyone had as much fun as i did.....
-sarvi

At 1:12 PM 4/24/96, Wayne D. Correia wrote:

>THIS IS AN OLD RUMOR (from November 1995!) and as far as I know IT'S A
>BUNCH OF SHIT, and you are *SO IRRESPONSIBLE* for posting this.
>
>And no, I am not a part of Nomad Interactive, but they *are* my friends,
>and they don't deserve this kind of treatment. Their biggest crime is being
>from out of town (Chicago, three years ago) and different (not 18 year old
>rave kids, but working professionals).
>
>Let me reiterate again that nobody deserves this kind of undeserved slander.

Wayne (and the rest of SF Raves):

I most certainly am *not* irresponsible for asking a question which I, and
the rest of the SF Raves community should have answered.  When I asked
several friends about the event in question, I got the same response:

That they heard rumors about something sneaky going on with those parties.

If SF Raves is a free forum (as the hundreds of posts pouring into my
mailbox attest to) about the SF rave scene, then it is most certainly
appropriate to appeal to the group for their input on what, in my opinion,
is a very serious issue.

I did not intend to slander anybody.  In fact, I did not.  What I did do
was put a rumor before the mailing list and ask for responses.  To quote:

>The reason I ask is that I've heard a rumor floating around that this
>party >*might* be hosted by people of the "swine" persuasion.  Can anybody
>confirm or >refute this statement?

Notice the "might".  See -- that means I don't know anything for sure.  I'm
asking for help.  Several other people have responded that they've heard
the same rumor, so I'm not just pulling this out of my ass.  Anyhow, I've
received enough positive responses that I feel comfortable attending.  And
the issue here really isn't the drug/illicit activity thing.  What really
bothered me is that authorities *might* see fit to entrap hundreds of
people who have their lives ahead of them and much to offer the world in
exchange for a bit of publicity and a "victory" in the war on drugs.

I do agree that rumors can be very damaging.  I did not intend to
perpetuate this one.

Oh, and Wayne -- yelling is terrible netiquette.

Oliver Raskin (a working professional, too!)

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Wed Apr 24 15:25:04 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) id PAA01274; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:25:04 -0700
Received: from arl-img-4.compuserve.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) with ESMTP id PAA01213; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:24:56 -0700
Received: by arl-img-4.compuserve.com (8.6.10/5.950515)
	id SAA13803; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 18:24:24 -0400
Date: 24 Apr 96 18:23:06 EDT
From: Leslie Ayres <71165.755@CompuServe.COM>
To: "sfraves@hyperreal.com" <sfraves@hyperreal.com>
Subject: ALL THIS SEX, DANCE, PORNO STUFF
Message-ID: <960424222306_71165.755_GHL105-1@CompuServe.COM>
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Warning, long and rambling, sorry...

One thing I like about email is that I get to compose our thoughts, and others
read our whole post before responding -- 

In person, we might be talking over each other, interrupting, thinking about our
next words, and degenerating into a pointless argument instead of listening to
the other person's ideas.... (yeah, I know, we've had some cyber-screaming
matches here, too!)  

so..... I wanted to say that these dialogs about condoms, sex, dancing,
pornography are fascinating.... 

Some of the posts really get my hackles up, some of them are totally right on
(IMHO of course), and when I read some of them, my heart breaks a little and I
want to wrap my arms around the person.  

But mostly, my goal is to read these posts with an open mind, and learn ....
this is hardest but most important when the person is coming from a completely
different set of beliefs and values than I am....

I know nada about Traci Lords, but I do know that the opinions being expressed
about sex, pornography and morality are touching some very deep and emotional
issues, and several posters have shared some very personal background with us to
help us understand their point of view.  

We each see the world through our own experiences, and we can never really
understand another's viewpoint without sharing their experiences. 

Here's a tool I use when I find myself being judgmental about others ... I ask
myself, 

	what if ...

	my mother/father/sister/brother/lover/child/lover

	        is a...    or was a ...

	hooker/porn star/junkie/gay/Marine/Jehovah's Witness/whatever

Would it make my judgment different?  Would I give more respect to their
opinions or actions if I knew them, loved them, already respected them?  
So...  what if my sister decided to make porn?  or my best friend?  What are my
judgments then?  Funny how my mind opens up a little when these dilemmas are
personalized. 

Bottom line, seems to me, is that when it comes to issues of morality, which
would include sex and sexuality, pornography, drugs, etc... these are personal
decisions, and each of us must do what is right for us... AND... we need to keep
our minds open and try to leave room for other perspectives.   

And maybe we also need to remember that, when we feel ourselves reacting to
something with anger and strong judgment, there may be more going on than meets
the eye, and we've been given a good opportunity to dig a little deeper and
understand ourselves a little more.

                     The End   ; )               Leslie

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Wed Apr 24 15:38:53 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) id PAA02722; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:38:53 -0700
Received: from dfw-ix11.ix.netcom.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) with ESMTP id PAA02707; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:38:49 -0700
Received: from  (tahsina@ala-ca10-09.ix.netcom.com [199.35.209.137]) by dfw-ix11.ix.netcom.com (8.6.13/8.6.12) with SMTP id PAA02222 for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:39:34 -0700
Date: Wed, 24 Apr 1996 15:39:34 -0700
Message-Id: <199604242239.PAA02222@dfw-ix11.ix.netcom.com>
From: tahsina@ix.netcom.com (Stacey Mccormick)
Subject: Fusion/Nomad Interactive response
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hello fellow ravers,
This is Stacey and Tom from Nomad Interactive. We felt the need to 
post a public response after the recent onslaught of online rumors
regarding Nomad Interactive.
We are working professionals living in the SF area for the past three
years. We were definitely inspired by the local rave community because
of the good people we met and the positive experiences we have had.
We have been putting parties together over the past year with the
intention of bringing people together under one roof to experience
something positive through music. You may know some of our parties
under the names of SPLISH boat party, FREAKOUT, XNTRK, ORIGIN, and
FUSION.
Although most of our events have focused on house music we truly
enjoy hard techno/trance as well as most other styles of music.
One of our favorite parties is F&F which we attend whenever possible.
In fact, some of our F&F friends who have helped us put the parties
together are people like Wayne Correia, Tim (Knucklehead), Micheal 
Clay, just to name a few.

There are a few people in the scene, who for their own reasons or self
interest, do not like us. These people continue to perpetuate rumors
against us. We have gone out of our way to prove that these rumors
are not true. We will be glad to give any information to whoever
is concerned regarding the truth of the matter. There are responsible
people in the scene who know the facts and are willing to talk to
anybody who is truly concerned.

Meanwhile, we are working very hard to put these events together and 
anyone who has been in that position understands all the struggles 
that face promoters during this process. We will continue to do our 
best to provide a safe and fun environment for people to come together.

We are part of the scene. We are here to contribute to the scene, not
to take away from the scene and we continue to learn and grow day by
day and appreciate life.

We want to thank all our friends who have believed and trusted in us
through everything we have experienced together over the past year.
Please feel free to email us if you have any questions.

Sorry for the cross post everyone, but this weekend if any of you happen to
live in the Portland, OR area, "Consciousness Lab Ambient Sound Research"
and "RE:" will be performing live ambient/idm as well as dj'ing the same
kinda stuff at Reed College in Portland, Oregon.  We will be doing a crazy
marathon 20 hour set starting Friday night and going to Saturday afternoon.
Then we will head over to the "Light Party" somewhere else in Portland for
another 4 hour set.  There are five of us in all so it will be a little
crazy, but it should be mega fun.  I think the space we will be playing in
is called the Black Lodge or something like that.  The event is some kind of
fair that will last all weekend.  I am also told there will be some sort of
rave area "techno tent."  I'm not sure if the event cost's any money.  Hope

Just a quick note to agree about Gaia...thought the Dimension 7 team did a
great job with visuals (as usual)..the music was great especially from about
1AM onward. The place was so huge it never seemed crowded or hot, twice as
many people could have fit comfortably, but probably not in the dance area.
I heard 3-4 thousand was the turnout but I don't know how accurate that is.
Where did they get that giant gold Buddha?????? The only problem was BART
didn't start running in the morning until 8AM, so we had to stay longer than
we planned.

jd



>> >
>> Speaking of Gaia,  could someone PLEASE give a report?
>> 
>> I heard it was at Home Base...  How many people attended?  HOw was ths
>> music?    Was it trance?  House?  HArdcore (wishful thinking)?
>> 
>> Crunchman
>
>Well if you insist. The party was not at Home Base but rather
>a huge warehouse nearby. I always become hesitant when I hear
>"virgin warehouse", but to the best of knowledge this was the
>first party thrown there. 
>
>My friends and I got there about 11:15 and waited in line for less 
>than 5 minutes, pretty cool. When you walked in there was a huge
>foyer, with all the dealers, of course. To the right were two chill
>rooms.
>
>The first was a living room sized room full of couches. The floor
>was covered with matresses. The adjoining room looked pretty trippy,
>but that became the spot where someone sold nitris all night long.
>
>The other chill room was much larger, also with couches, and a
>fairly large sound system for that space.
>
>As for the main dance floor...They had a giant Buddha behind the DJ
>where the lasers shot over the dance floor. They had a row of several
>large translucent pieces of cloth hanging from the ceiling that the 
>laser shot through. Pretty interesting effect. The place was pretty
>packed, it wasn't too hot, and our buddies Lyon security were pretty
>much keeping to themselves.
>
>I personally thought the vibe was great. I ran into a lot of my old
>raver friends and met many new ones. Everyone seemed to be having a
>good time.
>
>As for the music, DJ Dan ripped it up again as usual, and I was
>particularly impressed with Vicious Vic's set. I heard more breakbeat,
>not as much trance, But a good mix of different styles. But then again 
>I was bouncing around all over the place that night so I might have
>missed something..
>
>I don't know how many but there were tons of people there. The space 
>was so big it never got too packed. I'd guess somewhere around a few 
>thousand attended???
>
>We left around 7am, when the place really started to thin out. I saw 
>two cops as I left looking around but they didn't do anything.
>
>All in all I feel it was a great party. Props to Full Circle for 
>pulling this event off. PLUR
>                                          Hugs,
>                                           CT
>
>

Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

>The reason I ask is that I've heard a rumour floating around that this
>party *might* be hosted by people of the "swine" persuasion.

I'm not a lawyer (but I play one on TV).

All I can say is:

If "cops" were throwing parties, that would really constitute entrapment.

If they were getting leaked information and using that to nab people
driving away from parties while still "on drugs", that would be another. Or
using that leaked info to nab dealers.

Authorities with their war on drugs need to get the most bang for their
buck. They can't afford to arrest everyone who uses, especially people who
_aren't_ being (or looking like they could be) a nuisance to society. Most
drug charges come from being stopped or arrested for something else - maybe
you're insulting the officer or you are driving too fast (or poorly).

If they just wanted to make some mass arrests, they could come to any party
- let's face it, most happen at one of several known venues anyway.

Stop being so paranoid about "The Man" and learn how to cooly deal with the
situations you encounter him in.

-Rusty

> 
> >The reason I ask is that I've heard a rumour floating around that this
> >party *might* be hosted by people of the "swine" persuasion.
> 
> I'm not a lawyer (but I play one on TV).
> 
> All I can say is:
> 
> If "cops" were throwing parties, that would really constitute entrapment.

NOTE:  Please remember that I am not talking about the Origin people,
I am placing forth a purely theoretical situation:

I don't think that cops would throw parties to bust people at the parties.
What scares me is narcs throwing parties and building a circle of
friends, ie, a scene, that has complete trust in them.  From this scene
they could slowly work their way up into higher and higher levels of 
the network, until they find a source.

I mean, really, if you wanted an MDMA bust, where would you start?
How would you infiltrate?  Now that I think about it, such a idea is
NOT too far-fetched.

Ever read Phillip K. Dick's "A Scanner Darkly"?  The Vice scene is
completely and entirely 100% insane.

-troy

Subject: Consciousness Lab at Progress?
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

In my unhappy review of Progress, I forgot to mention one of the major
disappointments of the night!

Did Consciousness Lab play at all?  The promotor told me they would be in
the front room (the small jungle room) from 4:30 to 6.  I stayed WAY later
than I wanted to just to see the performance.  At 5, when a jungle dj was
still spinning away, I decided to give up and leave.  Rick, what happened?
Did anyone see this performance?

Consciousness Lab performed at the other Progress I went to last summer,
using tibetan bowls and aboriginal horns to create meditational tones and
intense vibrations in the chill room.  VERY VERY cool!!  I was very excited
by this element of the sacred in the rave.  I had always wondered what the
instruments were...and then in my spirituality class at Cal a few days ago,
a Daoist master spoke to us and ended the talk with a group meditation
accompanied by the tones of the same bowl.  Synchronicity!  So I was hyped
for it on Saturday...

Also in my review I had mentioned that the music did not help build a group
vibe, IMO.  But I neglected to mention that I saw no evidence of people
personally creating a vibe.  The smile factor was very very low.  In fact,
people weren't even meeting each other's eyes.

It only occurs with our openness...  Even a "bad" rave contains lessons!

Love to you all,
Nancy

Ok.  Some days I'm on, and some days I'm off.  Today was *NOT* a good day...

I mentioned in an earlier post that a rumor had gone around that some 
promoters had managed to have the original space for All in the Family 
busted.  I also went on to criticize the *unnamed* promoters for events 
they'd put on.  Well, I have been straightened out on both scores.

Anybody got any ketchup?  This foot isn't exactly tastey...

First, it was pointed out to me that I've been to a couple of functions put 
on by these promoters that I really enjoyed.  I didn't know at the time that 
they were responsible for pulling those parties off.  This definitely makes 
the sentiments I expressed earlier seem pretty spiteful.  Somebody slap me 
on the back of the head, ok?

Second, I put the question out in general but I also sent a few mail 
messages off to specific people, and I've gotten no hard facts.  Somebody 
said this, and somebody said that, but no hard and fast names/dates/places 
or first-hand accounts.  On the other hand, several people sent me mail 
telling me, in no uncertain terms, that rumors similar to this one have gone 
around before, and they couldn't be further from the truth.  

I figured that, since I hadn't named anyone, I wasn't adding fuel to the 
fire.  Unfortunately, it seems a lot more people than just myself heard the 
same rumor, and I did in fact add to the tension by the tone of my message 
and even inspired some more vitriolic missives.  Did anyone slap me on the 
back of the head yet?  Could you also kick me a couple of times?

Tom and Stacey, my heartfelt apologies.  Now that I've got your email 
address, if I have any questions on this sort of thing I'll send them to you 
directly.  I honestly did not intend to stir up the kind of negativity that 
went around today.  I too have heard other rumors, but I've also met and 
chatted with you, and you're real nice people.  I've been told, in the 
course if the day's correspondence, that you've received some extremely 
hateful voice and email messages.  I'm sorry to hear that, and I hope 
everyone just calms down and remembers:

        RUMORS AREN'T FACTS.

Hm.  Could someone hurry with that ketchup?

S

Ok, enough cattiness, judgements, and negative vibes for one day!  Since I 
did my part to make today less that pleasurable on this list, how about a joke?

A young couple was driving down the road one day, happily, deliriously in 
love and due to be married the next day.  Suddenly, a large truck swerved 
from the oncoming lanes into their car!  BOOM!  And they both died.

At the Pearly Gates, the young couple confronted St. Peter.  "Sir, you have 
to help us!  We were to be married tomorrow.  Is there any way we can be 
married in Heaven?"

"Hmmm," replied St. Peter, "I don't recall there ever being a marriage in 
Heaven.  Well, let's take it up with God and see what he says."

So they approached God with their plea.  God sat for a moment, pondering the 
request.  Then he looked down and said, "Come back in five years and ask me 
again."

Five years later, the couple approached God again, even more in love than 
ever and pleading that he allow their marriage.  God paused for quite a 
while, musing over their request.  Then he spoke, "Come back in five years 
and ask me again."

And once again, five years later, the couple was again in the presence of 
God, more in love than ever and begging God's permission for the third time 
to marry.  This time God smiled broadly and thundered, "Yes my children, you 
may marry!"

Well, the wedding went off beautifully, the reception was huge, everyone 
thought the bride was simply breathtaking and the groom was soooo handsome, 
and everyone was happy!  What a fine couple!  What a splendid wedding!  Until...

Two years later, the couple was back before God, and things were not looking 
so good.  The couple had come to the realization almost immediately that 
marriage was not what they were made for, and in spite of their struggles to 
come to terms with the situation, they had decided there simply was no 
alternative but to get a divorce.

Black clouds fractured by lightening rolled across the sky, and the ground 
shook with explosive thunder.  God glared down at the tiny couple before 
him, his face becoming dark and angry, and he roared, "Divorce?!  It took us 
ten years just to find a priest in Heaven!  Do you have any idea how long it 
will take to find a LAWYER?!!"

8)

S

>Wisconsin thrown by Drop Bass every year since 1994...FURTHUR.  Well, here =
is
>the flyer for you, incase any of you are interested in traveling.  I must s=
ay,
>it is definitely a great way to kick off the summer, and worth the drive...
>If you have any questions, email me at follkj10@gbvaxa.uwgb.edu and I'll be
>glad to help you.  Hope some of you can make it!
>

>........ T H R E E   F U R T H U R   S O U N D   S T A G E S ..............=
....
>
>1. Main stage by MAXXIMUM SOUND of Louisville, KY.  This system features an=
 all
>   Carver powered Gauss system providing the cleanest mid/highs and the dee=
pest
>   hard hitting bass you can imagine.  The technician is the foreigh freque=
ncy
>   wizard from the south known to everyone as FrenchE.
>
>2. Live music rock stage provided by DIVERSIFIED AUDIO of Chicago, IL.  The
>   sound on this stage featured Crest Audio powered EV speakers.  No need t=
o
>   hype this system, they do almost every event in the midwest!  Soundman i=
s
>   none other than the infamous Sal.
>
>3. Midwest focus stage supplied by Drop Bass Network's SUBKULTURE AUDIO.  T=
his
>   one features a Crest Audio powered Jr. Earthquake and JBL system... You'=
ve
>   probably heard it many times at the numerous free and mid sized events i=
n
>   the area.  It gets the job done!
>
>Along with the three official event stages there will be numerous D.I.Y. so=
und
>systems scattered throughout the festival site with their own djs.  Some of
>those included are Network 10 (mil), Massive (mil), MJ-12 (FonDuLac), as we=
ll
>as no-name rigs from Minneapolis, Milwaukee, Chicago, Iowa, and Madison.  I=
f
>you're interested in bringing a sound system to the event you must contact =
Drop
>Bass at 414-224-5343.  The site can only support a set number of systems an=
d
>there are guidelines that need to be adhered to.
>
>........ L I G H T I N G   &   L A S E R S ................................=
....
>
>As with past Furthur events the lighting will be minimal yet effective.  At=
 an
>oudoor event it's had to top mother nature's display of the moon and stars.=
  To
>add to her splendor MAXXIMUM (Louisville) and the OMEN (Milwaukee) will=
 team up
>with EYEGASM (Louisville) to provide a wonderful show of lights including
>miniscans and god lights with laser vipers and laser emulators.  Their
>impressive work is guaranteed to please your eyes. Add to this two separate
>lasers from LASERFORCE (Milwaukee) lighting up the night time sky.  Saturda=
y's
>laser is a 40 watt skyward bound Jag laser that will cover the entire festi=
val
>site.  Sunday features a 5 watt argon that will be contained in the main st=
age
>area.  As a special surprise there will be a show in the sky Sunday night t=
o
>close out this marvelous weekend.  We want it to be a surprise but for know=
 we
>can tell you it goes bang and sparkles!
>
>........ V I S U A L S ....................................................=
....
>
>Don't expect anything less than madness from a madman!  That's what you can
>expect from DEMON PUPPET (formerly Brain Farm) and his display of unusual a=
nd
>disturbing mind altering film loops and live video mixing.  All we can say =
is
>that you've been warned.
>
>........ F U R T H U R   G U I D E L I N E S ..............................=
....
>
>Furthur takes place in rural Wisconsin Memorial Day Weekend beginning at no=
on
>on Friday May 24 straight through until Monday May 27 - over 72 plus hours!
>The sound stages are weather protected, making this event go rain or shine.
>Come prepared for the possibility of inclement weather.
>
>The location for Furthur will remain a secret until May 23.  On that date y=
ou
>can call any of the main info lines or support lines in your area for
>directions and information.  We can tell you that as in years past the even=
t
>will be located as equidistant as possible from Milwaukee, Chicago,
>Minneapolis, Madison, and the Fox Valley.  This means your travel time from=
 any
>of these cities will be in the 1-4 hour range.  The secrecy is used in an
>effort to not draw any unnecessary attention to the event site and to help =
add
>to the excitement and anticipation of the event itself.
>
>On site concessions including hot and cold food and beverages will be avail=
able
>at reasonable prices. Drinkable water will also be made available for your
>convenience.
>
>To avoid potential problems between the people who attend Furthur and the
>people in the communities around the event location, there will only be two=
 in
>and out priveleges per car over the course of the event.  We realize that s=
ome
>of us look and act different than the usually conservative people in rural
>Wisconsin.  To minimize any relations problems and to lesson the impact of =
our
>event on the area this step is necessary.  Sorry for any inconveniences thi=
s
>may cause.  You can help change things by showing respect for the people an=
d
>property in the local communities. Through kindness and positive attitudes =
we
>can help in the process of change that makes everyone more open minded.  Af=
ter
>all, this is part of the extended vision for the reason we gather in the fi=
rst
>place.  Remember a few bad apples can ruin it for everyone.  It's up to=
 each of
>you to present our culture positively.
>
>There are absolutely no guest list privileges.  If you are one of the
>"important" people who expect this, come prepared to pay like everyone else=

>I guess as a DJ, I am insulted by her, using her fame as an ex porno star

Well, I would also suggest that there are others who do the craft far
worse.  For instance, many of the big names who come into town.  Yep, they
make the records people buy, yep they make the music that makes tears go
down one's eye....but they couldn't spin their way out of a box, much less
mix.  Now who is the poser?  These guys ask for $$$, and do doo-doo on the
dex.  Now that, IMO is wack!

Doing porno is easy...when the director tell you to get it up, do it.  If
it takes 2-4 hours to finish a scene, stay 'up'.  And when it's time for
the 'money shot' you better deliver on cue.  Not so bad.  Oh yeah, don't
forget the crew of guys standing around watching you, and watch out for
camera two, hey pup, move your leg over to the left, that's it, hey keep
your voice down, too much talking....

the calendar and from now until June 1st these is only one live performer -
Miisa and that was last Thurs the 18th.  The only memorable live persormers
I recall were y-Ziq (uk) and Freaky Chakra, and of course now Sky Lab 2000
(hehe BP)... and I would have gone to see Eat Static but they were
cancelled.  :(

them and this is why no one books them?  There seems to be a steady flow of
import DJ's to SF (However, I would love to hear more from the LA scene;
Christopher Lawerence, Thomas Micheal, Trance, Doran, Ron D. Core to name a
few I have heard and like).

getting them up here.

Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.93.960424213116.29281C-100000@elaine31.Stanford.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

On Tue, 23 Apr 1996, Eric P. Peterson wrote:

>         In this scene and in all scenes, broadening out to every aspect of
> life, when are men gonna realize that women are where it's at?  Women are
> all goddesses, just as men are all gods, because we all spring from the
> divine energy of the multiverse, and carry some of it with us in the
> -essence of our being.  Women are complex and special creatures in far
more
> ways than are men.  Women are to be revered and respected, not worshipped
> or degraded.  To go a step further, everyone has value, unless he/she
> devalues him/herself.  Women are still making breakthroughs in our society,
> though many times they are met with resistance, and many times for no good
> reason.  The human species cannot grow and develop to our maximum potential
> unless men and women are encouraged to contribute unlimited.
>         MHO?  Yes, but more than that.  My Viking and Celtic ancestors
> treated women in their societies much better than many other societies
> throughout history; they were allowed to own land and participate in
> government for centuries.  Where/when did things go wrong?  Anyone care to
> comment on any of this?
>         (Inspired by Nancy, who encouraged me to initiate a post, rather
> than just replying all the time :))
> 
> Love & respect,
> 
> - E
> 
> 

> 

Hello All!

I'm new to the list...so I've been a "voyeur" of sorts, trying to get a
feel for it. And Erik...you've finally coaxed me out of my silent shell!
Kudos to you!

It seems that "industrialized" society has definitely taken a wrong turn
at some point in time towards its treatment of women.  Just thought I
would share with you all some examples of AWESOME female status in past
societies.

"Ecstatic" dancing has been part of ancient Japanese, Chinese, and Korean
cultures during shawmanistic rituals during which female priestesses would
display their powers.  These women priesteses were STAR.  

The Ah-Goot women of ancient Korea would practice drumming fests in which
women were the sole musicians and dancers.  Peace and harmony were said to
follow these rituals.

Legends say the "Wu" priestesses in ancient China would slash
themselves and emerge from their ritual dancing unscathed and completely
beaming with positive, healing energy.

I don't know about the masochistic part, but that's definitely how I feel
after a full night of receiving and sending out good vibes at a RAVE!
Could it be our modern day interpretation of such "healing" practices?
I'd like to think so! :)

Other random tidbits:

-The first novel ever written, Tale of Genji, was written by LADY
	Murasaki.
-Pharoah's rule originally passed through a matrilineal line.
-The Beloved Women were the head of Cherokee counsel...and they would
	ultimately approve or negate the tribe's decision to go to war.
-Pueblo societies laughed at the notion of their men being sent off to
	do the heavy work of building houses by the Spaniard
	Conquistadors.  Such work was the pride-filled responsibility of
	women.
 
So basically, I'm trying to make a point that WOMEN'S and GODDESS power
crosses the barriers of race, culture, time, and form. Does anyone out
there think that raving goes beyond expression and into the field of
WOMEN'S empowerment?  I'd like to hear your thoughts.

Power to you all-

Ivana

> 
> If "cops" were throwing parties, that would really constitute entrapment.
> 
> If they were getting leaked information and using that to nab people
> driving away from parties while still "on drugs", that would be another. Or
> using that leaked info to nab dealers.
> 
> Authorities with their war on drugs need to get the most bang for their
> buck. They can't afford to arrest everyone who uses, especially people who
> _aren't_ being (or looking like they could be) a nuisance to society. Most
> drug charges come from being stopped or arrested for something else - maybe
> you're insulting the officer or you are driving too fast (or poorly).
> 
> If they just wanted to make some mass arrests, they could come to any party
> - let's face it, most happen at one of several known venues anyway.
> 
> Stop being so paranoid about "The Man" and learn how to cooly deal with the
> situations you encounter him in.
> 
> -Rusty
> 
> 
> 

Hi!
 I may be dating myself but this info is important. I used to see the 
Grateful Dead fairly regularly, from the late seventies on up to the late 
eighties. There was quite a community vibe amongst the deadheads, what 
with the communal market place that always popped in any parking lot of 
any dead show. At first it was really wonderful. As time wore on (as it 
always does) the dead became more and more popular and the parking lot 
crowds grew -- some to hang out and enjoy the vibe -- others to cater to 
the unique consummer market that the dead heads provided. Eventually this 
attracted the attention of law enforcement officials including the DEA. 
Eventually the joke (and not a funny one) was that the DEA was on tour 
(with the dead heads). A LOT of arrests went down mostly because dealers 
and ordinary folk were not discreet and downright sloppy in their 
attitudes. If you are breaking the law, you will be busted if you are 
habitually sloppy. 


Ran
                                     (plink)
                                        /
                                  -=*=-/
                                    ~

One of the members of C-Lab (Brad) was scheduled to DJ, and as far as I know
he did.  A friend of mine who went said he did spin and a great set at that.
C-Lab is a collective of artists and dj's.  When you see the name on a flier
it can mean one of many things.  The two Progress parties that we played
live at were parties where C-Lab was givin the ambient space for the entire
night.  If you see C-Lab scheduled amoung 5 other dj's, it probably means
that one of us will be dj'ing and representing C-Lab.  We probably (but you
never really know) won't play live if we only get a two hour set.  For
instance, I'm sure you saw my bsp yesterday where we will be playing a 20
hour set in Portland.  That's more like it.  If you ever have any questions
as to whether we will be playing live or not at an event, e-mail me and ask.
Actually, if we are playing live, I'll probably say something to the list.
Take it easy, and sorry for the confusion.

Rick

>accompanied by the tones of the same bowl.  Synchronicity!  So I was hyped

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Wed, 24 Apr 1996 20:37:55 -0700 (PDT)
From: Daniel J. MacMillan <djm@crl10.crl.com>
To: Troy Sheets <tsheets@xanadu.cyborganic.net>
Subject: Re: condommania!

 At the risk of giving new life to the dreaded 'condommania!' thread, my
review of a new polyethylene condom is below. Those of you who don't like 
sex-talk on the list should probably bail now ... Thanks.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

These were 'Avanti' condoms, and came in a package of six. The price 
worked out to ~ $1.25/ea.

misc observations;

*These seems to be cut a bit wider than conventional latex condoms, but a 
bit more narrow than Trogan 'Large' variety. 

*The material these are made of is a plastic, and therefore has much less 
'stretch' to it than latex. If you were much smaller, or much larger than
the condom, this might be a problem.

the good;

*I liked the lubrication a lot. There was less of it than on the Trojan's 
I'm use to, and it was odorless. Lately the smell of either the 
spremacide or lubrication on those Trojan's has been bugging me, so this 
was nice. I also would rather have less lubrication, and add more if 
necessary, than be sloshing around in it.

*For me, sensitivity was noticeably better than with latex ... As much as 
20-30%. Heat-transfer was also better. Obviously, these are BIG 
plusses.

the bad;

*The packages were really hard for me to open. The wrapper had a little 
'tear here' cutout, but I kept just ripping the corners off. Neither my 
fingers nor teeth did a very effective job.

*Out of the six we used, one broke (thankfully, not at the wrong time). 
It should be noted that we were going at it pretty aggressivly, but we've 
put many latex condoms through similar paces, and haven't had one fail 
yet. 

the conclusion;

I say give 'em a try. We're going to consider the one breakage a chance 
happening, and cross our fingers. They felt better to me than the best 
latex I've used ... Hopefully they will prove to be as durable.

-Dan

Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com
In-Reply-To: <v03005b0aada46885f276@[157.22.222.199]>; from "Rusty H. Hodge" at Apr 24, 96 4:28 pm

X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.3 PL11]
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Rusty H. Hodge said:
> 
> But look at how many "sting" cases get thrown out of court because it was
> considered entrapment.

How many do? I don't know any stats.  I used to assume that shit
like that would be thrown out of court.  But cases don't get
"thrown out of court" for entrapment.  People get acquitted
when they can prove they were entrapped.

But point is, you have to say that you WERE guilty of doing something wrong,
but that you wouldn't have done it if it weren't for the officers.

So if you start off your defense saying that you are "Not Guilty"
you can't yell "Entrapment" later on.  And how easy is it to
prove that it's entrapment?

"Officer, did you approach the young man and flirt with him,
and hint that you would have sex with him if only you had some acid?"

"No"

"Defendant, did the officer approach you and flirt with you,
and hint that she would have sex with you if only she had some acid?"

"Yes"

And it's not just a matter of what the law says, it's a matter of
what the jury thinks and what the jury thinks the law says.
If the jury buys into the "Drugs are Evil" scheme of things,
chances are, they aren't going to be that nitpicky over
the details of how things happened.  YOU bought/sold drugs.
THAT is illegal.  Who cares WHY or HOW you did it?

And even if the jury isn't the type to just say "Drugs are Evil",
they would have to be told and proven that the way the
cops arrested you was illegal.  On a jury, you can't just say:
"Hey that was entrapment!"  I mean, you can, but chances
are teh otehr jurors won't beleive you unless the lawyer
brought up proof of it.  (Not to mention that you aren't really
supposed to make presumptions about the law yourself :)

I wouldn't really trust entrapment to get you out of much.
There are too many ways around it using third parties 
and out and out lying.

 
 ,
dana

For 5 grams of crack cocaine, you receive a minimum 5 year sentence without
parole.  For powder cocaine, it takes 500 grams to receive the same sentence.

Hello all on sf-raves!  I hope I don't tick anyone off for posting here 
because I'm not from the bay area (not even close, in fact).  I'm from 
Green Bay, Wisconsin, which is my primary reason for writing this.
	I'm an aspiring dj who has a majority of the equipment.  The 
thing I am lacking is a collection of the San Francisco house I love so much.
The midwest is very hardcore and trance oriented, and aside from shopping 
in Chicago for records (which makes for an expensive and infrequent trip), I 
have an extremely hard time finding the right tunes.  Mail order is cool 
and all, but when you don't even know what artists or labels to ask for, 
it doesn't do much good.
	
	So anyway, to get right down to it, I borrowed a mixtape from a 
friendthat was mixed by one DJ Dan, who I am told is from San Francisco.  
I loved the entire tape and finally was able to hear a whole 90 minutes 
of the house I want to spin someday.
	If any of you would be so kind as to help me out, I have one or 
two questions:

1.  If any of you know the playlist for the first side of his tape, I 
would really appreciate having it mailed here.  This kind gesture would be 
the equvalent of giving up one of your kidneys for charity.

2.  Would any of you be interested in sending me a list, large or small, 
of San Francisco house labels, artists, stores that carry this style of 
house, and/or anything else you think relevant to my search?


	If you've gotten this far, thank you for reading my post, wether or not 
you are able to help! :)  I will really, 
really, really appreciate any help you west coast ravers can offer me!

		Thanks again, Brian   :)

IMO, DJDan is the best DJ the west coast has to offer.  There's a lot of 
talent out here, but with all the monotonous noNRG trance out here Dan 
will make any party a bomb.  As far as giving you the playlist for the 
tape you're asking for, I can do that if I know which tape it is.  (I 
have just about every Dan tape there is :)  Dan plays music from all 
around the world, not just from SF, but there's a ton of good labels out 
here.  Try:

www.dnai.com/~twitch
http://tripNspin.com/trippy/
http://hyperreal.com/music/labels/oobe/

Those are just a few anyone wanna help me out with some more?

	I guess some of you have heard about the tremendous
	rave called _Tribal_Gathering_ occurring in the UK on May 4th...
	There are *big* rumors that the event has been cancelled,
	but would be rescheduled on June 6th.

	Included below the "official" statement (*unverified*, this
	is said to be a fax from "Man Fiddler Organization", selling tix 
	for the event).
	
> Dated : April 24; 9:30 PM
> ==============================================================================
> The licence for Tribal gathering was not granted today (24 april) at Thames
> Magistrates Court. An appeal will now be made to the Crown Court and the
> organisers are very confident of obtaining the licence there.
> However because of the delayed decision at Thames Court and the time
> required to make the appeal, the event will have to be scheduled to
> saterday july 6th on the same site with the same artist/dj line up. Only
> the tickets currently in isuue will be valid for the rescheduled date.
> 
> We understand that this will inconvienence you more than ticket holders in
> the UK but as the statement already says - we are very confident of the
> event going ahead on the 6th july.
> We will of course keep you informed of any progress.
> ==============================================================================

-- 
Renaud Waldura                                   <http://www.essi.fr/~waldura/>

Radio/TV Shows

     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. KZSU
       90.1 (Stanford)
     * Monday afternoon 12:30-3:00 pm - DJ Jerecho presents the best of
       the urban polyrhythmic experience jungle, acid jazz, techno,
       electro, breakbeat KDVS, 90.3 FM (Davis)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning 3am-6am - "Aural Fixation"
       experimental sounds of ambient and trip hop with a splash of hi
       nrg, from trance to jungle. KZSC 88.1 fm (Santa Cruz)
     * Thursdays 9:30pm-midnight - "Aurora Borealis" Beats and
       atmospherics w/DJ Seth. KALX 90.7 (Berkeley)
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on KUSF
       90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Ambient, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, Acid Jazz
       and noise KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Saturday night 11pm - Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. flux@flux.net
     * Friday night - nocturnal transmissions - featuring house DJs from
       SF and around the world. mid-2am, 107.7 FM (SF)
     * Friday night - Your Mama's House w/Pete Avila - 3am-5am, 106.1
       KMEL.
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - "Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs from
       SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night - "Saturday Night Spin Out" w/Ronnie Libido. Trip
       hop, Jungle, Ambient, Experimental Sounds. 10pm-2am. KFJC 89.7 -
       Los Altos Hills

Administrative Notes

   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.com with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.com with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.

   
 Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.com

From: Leslie Ayres <71165.755@CompuServe.COM>
To: "sfraves@hyperreal.com" <sfraves@hyperreal.com>

I had to laugh at Jess's note to Larry...

>  You should consider yourself lucky Larry.  My dad's in town and he
>  wants to come to a rave! (and grow his hair and pierce his ears
 >  etc)...Although it's kind of a fun idea to bring him I really don't
>  think I'd have as much fun with him hanging around ya know!

>  sympathetically,  Jess

>  >  This weekend, I will be chaffeuring my Dad around the SF Bay area - 
>  > he's visiting me from out of town. So , no raves for me this weekend!

As a full-on, no-holds-barred raver, with way more than my ears pierced (though
my ear piercings are pretty awesome, I must say)..... and at 42 years old,
though my best friends are all 25-ish, and several more true friends as young as
18.... I always have to laugh that my own daughter, who's 18 in June, really
can't/doesn't want to hang out with me --- not just because she's not really
into raving, but more because, when it all comes down to it, I'm her mom -- and
there's something about that that's different, no matter how cool your mom is,
and no matter how cool your friends think she is ... she's still your mom.
(Though I did get her to go to the last F-8 beach party with me last year, which
was a highlight of my life, I think!  I wonder what would happen if she was a
raver, maybe we'd have to agree to go to different parties, or just work this
out somehow?!)

My own dad used to smoke pot with me when I was young, and he was pretty cool
really, but I remember how I really didn't want him hanging around, though my
friends thought he was great .... they still do, but to me, he's still my
dad....

Some things never change, eh?  When people I meet out say "wow, you're almost as
old as my mom" (hey, if I'm actually older than your mom, don't tell me,
ok?).... I remind them that I can pretty much guarantee that's as far as that
resemblence probably goes! 

With age and youth all wrapped up in one.....

Leslie   ; )

This is not a rumor and this post is directed to the wellfare of all ravers
who wish to partake in the taking of E for a good time.  If you have a
problem with this post direct it to me personally other wise feel free to
discuse.  I don't want to justify my post because most of you know E is a
part of our scene and I am sure everyone on this list knows some one that
has done it.  All I am saying here is be very careful, I love you all as a
family and would never want any harm to come to my brothers and sisters...

I just got informed of some very bad news regarding some of the E going
around in SF these days...
A friend of mine knows for a fact that some of the E going around is not E
at all but straight heroin and some tylenols are a mix of the two.  I know
this is going on in NY and LA however the pills are marketed as heroin,
however, some scrupless dealers are selling them as E here in the bay area.
One friend of mine took 2 of the mixed pills and was so f#@ked up he
couldn't move for hours and if you tried to look at him he just looked
through you.
    I am sooooo pissed this shit goes on.  These people who do this have no
respect for people's safety.  Yeah, drugs are bad and illeagal but that is
no reason to ignore a problem that occures in our community.  Two other
ways I know this is possible - A dumb ass friend of mine took a capsule of
"E" a week before a drug test.  Well the test came up positive with 5 drugs
in his system.  Besides the weed, the rest was in the E he had been taking
which included - MDA, heroin, and two types of amphetamines - notice no
MDMA...  Also, a friend of a friend told me (not a very cretable sorce), he
had his E tested and it contained a little MDMA, crank, and heroin.  These
were all seperate instances.  <**I appologise, I have no chemical names for
you or the acctuall tests but my friend is very reliable and I have known
him for half my life**>

By the way my friend lost his job but is now in rehab for drug addiction.
Can I just say I HATE SPEED!!  aaaaaarrrrhhhhh!

RE: narcs  was April 26, Fusion
I don't wanna post twice so I'll add this to my post-

Early last year at Cearsars on Market?? I went to this party.  Dunno what
it was called now but I ran into this short guy on the way up the stairs.
He said excuss me and then asked me where he could get some "ecstacy".  I
said I didn't know and went on my merry way.  Larter on in the night I saw
him crusin' around by himself, dancin' here and there; when a girlfriend of
mine pointed him out to me and she said he was a narc and told me not to
talk to him.  thought nawww, she's just parinoid, there's no narcs at
parties.  Half hour or so passed and the same guy walked up to me again and
asked me where I could get any acid.  I thought ?[didn't he just ask me for
X].  Nope I said to him.  He sat next to me and proceded to tell me some
fantacy/need about getting some acid that night for his girlfrind and I
asked him "didn't you ask me if I had any X earlier?" He said no, but could
I get him some of that too.  This guy was too desperate.  In the course of
the night(till 3am or so) three different people told me not to talk to him
cuz he was a narc AND I saw him leave and come back by himself twice during
the evening(what does ths mean, I don't know).  Well I don't know if anyone
was arrested cuz I left rather early but there was a deffinate police
presence outside.   Hhhhhmmmmmmm....

Good luck to you all..
Love,
Austin

On Thu, 25 Apr 1996, Austin wrote:

> This is not a rumor and this post is directed to the wellfare of all ravers
> who wish to partake in the taking of E for a good time.  If you have a
> problem with this post direct it to me personally other wise feel free to
> discuse.  I don't want to justify my post because most of you know E is a
> part of our scene and I am sure everyone on this list knows some one that
> has done it.  All I am saying here is be very careful, I love you all as a
> family and would never want any harm to come to my brothers and sisters...

Yes, this is going to sound negative, please do not take this personally, 
I just cringe when I see such unfounded disinformation:

The definition of a rumor is "1. a story or statement in general circulation 
without confirmation or certainty as to facts, 2. gossip; hearsay" 
Austin, everything, *EVERYTHING* you have posted with regards to the 
content of the E going around is hearsay. "My friend says this, my friend 
says that," this is the very definition of rumor. 

> I just got informed of some very bad news regarding some of the E going
> around in SF these days...
> A friend of mine knows for a fact that some of the E going around is not E
> at all but straight heroin and some tylenols are a mix of the two.  I know
> this is going on in NY and LA however the pills are marketed as heroin,
> however, some scrupless dealers are selling them as E here in the bay area.
> One friend of mine took 2 of the mixed pills and was so f#@ked up he
> couldn't move for hours and if you tried to look at him he just looked
> through you.

Let's examine this from a few standpoints:
 
1) Financial feasability: Heroin is generally considered to be a 
   highly-addictive drug that can cost significantly more than MDMA. It is
   most commonly distributed in a form condusive to intraveneous use, or 
   use by inhalation. What financial motive could a manufacturer of heroin 
   possibly have to produce heroin in an entirely different form from normal,
   and then sell it for less than they could receive by producing it its
   more common, and financially lucrative form? And to sell it to persons 
   that have no interest in the high produced by the use of heroin?  

2) "My friend knows": How? Has he had an analysis of the substance in 
    question made? Where are the results? 

3) "My friend took two pills and got fucked up" : And what does this prove?
    That he had a negative reaction to whatever constituted the substance
    he ingested, most certainly. But does a negative reaction to a substance
    indicate that it contains heroin? 

>     I am sooooo pissed this shit goes on.  These people who do this have no
> respect for people's safety.  Yeah, drugs are bad and illeagal but that is
> no reason to ignore a problem that occures in our community.  Two other
> ways I know this is possible - A dumb ass friend of mine took a capsule of
> "E" a week before a drug test.  Well the test came up positive with 5 drugs
> in his system.  Besides the weed, the rest was in the E he had been taking
> which included - MDA, heroin, and two types of amphetamines - notice no
> MDMA...  

I find this most interesting. Just what kind of drug test did he have 
that tested for the presence of two different type of amphetamines, and 
also the presence of MDA, and MDMA(both of which would register as 
amphetamines)? Austin, your statement is contradictory and simply doesn't 
make sense. 

I can produce a list of legal substance the length of my arm that 
can produce false positives in drug tests including poppy seeds(opium or 
heroin), decongestants containing ephedrine or pseudoephedrine(methamphetamines), 
and the list goes on.  

Also, a friend of a friend told me (not a very cretable sorce), he
> had his E tested and it contained a little MDMA, crank, and heroin.  These
> were all seperate instances.  <**I appologise, I have no chemical names for
> you or the acctuall tests but my friend is very reliable and I have known
> him for half my life**>

More rumors.  

Austin, I have no doubt your intentions are good, but you do no one a 
service with disinformation.  

                                            Black Adder

Yo-
        just wanted to put my two cents in about the recent visit by Dave
Clarke at MAD last Monday. Overall, I thought it was a very good night.
I like the club, the sound was pretty good and most importantly, people
seemed to enjoy themselves.  I think a lot of people have this impression
that because MAD is a techno/trance club, that the venue it takes place
in should be made entirely of corrugated aluminum siding with toxic waste
on the floors inside and rabid vermin scurrying underfoot.  I disagree.
As a venue, the bahia was booty because(among other reasons) it was a
restaurant converted into a club.  I didn't find it at all very
comfortable; sitting on those rattan chairs getting splinters in my
gluteous...trying to dance anywhere near the dj was at best hazardous;
the potential for busting the dj's groove being too high.  Not to mention
all the organizational tete-a-tete's that occurred on a frequent basis.
The new place comparatively is a gosdend.
        Anyhow, I had a good time on Monday, and I thought Dave Clarke
played pretty well.  And, I might add, contrary to popular belief he's a
fuckin' really cool guy.  Either that or we caught him in at a good time
in his life 'cuz I went to dinner with the guy before MAD and he was
more than cool~  He really liked san fran.  so much so that he made us 
drice him across the Golden Gate bridge while he told about how the U2 
remix he did recently paid for his new Volvo.  All in all, a good night 
indeed.  
.......	END JL TRANSMISSION V.2.......

*sigh* this sort of thing is the problem with the fact that things like e
aren't regulated in some way.  there are SOOO many people who know someone
who heard from a friend that they put this stuff in the caps/pills, this
person told that person that e makes hair grow on the palms of your hands
... i actually had someone try to convince me that their friend who is a
microbiology major knew that e in your system will cause chewing gum to 
turn squooshy and pulpy if you chew it for long enough.  Listen, bro (or 
sis), if you chew chewing gum STRAIGHT for seven hours it's probably gonna 
get a little tired :)

I never EVER buy at parties, only from the most reliable sources i have
(which, i admit, are only as reliable as the next link in the chain) ... 
and so far i have only gotten burned once *fingers crossed*.  I think ppl
who are sooo desperate for a high that they buy from just any ole person
who looks like they might know what they're talking about pretty much
deserves what they get.  That may sound harsh, but if _I_ can't get 
"reliable" e, i'll do without, thanks ... i'd rather just have a grand 
boogying time straight than take something from someone i've never seen 
before.

Now, lets see how many people flame me for THIS one :)

k

This I had to comment on, this happens. I think that when your on E (IMO)
you tend to chew and suck on that gum alot more then if your straight,
therefore it gets "tired" alot quicker then normal. I have had it happen to
me in both cases. I most of chewed a piece of gum for many hours and it got
so nasty I spit it out, and it was like spitting out water. I also had it
happen when I indulged at a party and I only chewed it for not even half the
time and did the same thing. I do remember that the gum was of the same
type. Sugarless or not sugarless I just don't remember which one it was. It
wasn't the same flavor though. So it's either the sugar free or not sugar
free. All I have to say about chewing gum until it turns into liquid is that
it is NASTY! yuck.

Anyway, just thought I'd throw in my .02 in since it happened to me.

Tim (knucklehead)

You might be right, but any time I have heard of things going on here
is has been a flop. I didn't know that anything went on in Stanford,
but I am glad to hear it. Also the main problem is that people WILL
travel to the city from here for an event, but not the opposite (RE:
Sign of a bad rave: "1:The map point is in Palo Alto" this was not by
me!!!!). I really wish there was something to do, but problems with
police...etc add to the difficulty (actually Stanford probably is the
only place to get away from this).  I do know people here who put on
events, but they do it WELL away from Palo Alto.

One thing to do is try to get as many people from this area in one
place for an night just to see what support there is, otherwise this
thread is just guess work. I am definately not opposed to trying, have
done so in the past and I am still working on it (although lately I've
been looking further afield). 

If you feel that your not connected to other people of similar social
tendencies I suggest hanging out in Rudy's bar on University Ave. as
there is a fair sized group of rave attending people there (mostly
Brits like myself). I'll probably be there tonight (as I cant put up
the effort to go to SF) and there has been talk of a house party (with
DJ's, 1200's...Etc) possibly later on.

Respect
Stephen

PS could you send me info on this Stanford event? Thanx

my hands" from someone I trust, then I'll lay out some money, but

Fellow SF Ravers...

I think that you'll recall a posting I sent three weeks ago in 
reference to two of my friends incredibly terrible experience with some 
bad e.  These were two seasoned ravers who have been taking e since the 
early 80s. What they went through that evening and the following days 
was scary enough to make one of them swear off substances forever. I 
had a total of 23 responses to that posting of which 14 mentioned bad e 
experiences in the bay area within the last 3 months.  I COULD CARE 
LESS IF E HAS HEROIN IN IT OR NOT that's not the point. The message to 
take home from Austin's post is that at this point in time there's some 
seriously bad e in this area. BE CAREFUL!

-SUNNY

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Fri Apr 26 13:17:15 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) id NAA26851; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 13:17:15 -0700
Received: from hydra.acs.uci.edu by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) with ESMTP id NAA26842; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 13:17:09 -0700
Received: (from dwatanab@localhost) by hydra.acs.uci.edu (8.7.1/8.7.1) id NAA18604 for sfraves@hyperreal.com; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 13:16:52 -0700 (PDT)
Message-Id: <199604262016.NAA18604@hydra.acs.uci.edu>
Subject: E Warnings
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com (sfraves@hyperreal.com)
Date: Fri, 26 Apr 96 13:16:51 PDT
From: DWATANAB@UCI.EDU (Dana Watanabe)
X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.3 PL11]
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

I have to put in a ditto because i was about to say the same thing.

Why do WE (as in most of the discussion groups on the net i've been in)
always spend more time denouncing the fact that Drug X could be 
being sold as Drug Y than dealing with the fact that Drug Y
did not react as most would expect?

It IS really important, i think, to not have people creating more
or repeating the same rumours about drugs and to have the right
information being spread since it's not going to be spread
by standard information spreading sources.

I would hope that would be the main goal.

But i think it's usually because people (like me for example)
just get fed up and annoyed with hearing the same rumour over and over and over
again. (Which is, i presume, the answer to the above question)

But responding in an annoyed manner usually doesn't help
the forementioned goal of spreading information.

The scenario i usually see:

> > My friend's friend bought some QQ last weekend and got really sick,
> > my other friend's other friend said that it had Boopies in it,
> > because they are just one molecule off and Boopies can show up
> > in poorly made QQ.

> WHAT?  BOOPIES?  Look, EVERYONE knows that BOOPIES cost more than
> QQ does, so why would someone do that?  Not to mention that boopies
> are only rectally active, so it wouldn't even do anything. And even
> beyond that, the dosage level for boopies is 10 times that of QQ,
> so unless your friend normally buys QQ with a lot of filler,
> they should be able to tell the difference.  And you and your friend
> need to go back to jr high school chemistry because EVERYONE ALSO
> knows that one molecule makes something pretty much a completely
> different thing altogether.  But more importantly, boopies are
> 4-Bromo-2,5,beta-trimethoxyphenethylamine and QQ is 3,9-trimethylmonoxidil
> which aren't even close!!!

Well, more or less.

I dont think the reaction on sfraves was bad in the least, but it
often gets ridiculous.  

The one thing that WAS pretty bad though, was that everyone was saying
"THAT CAN'T BE HEROIN!" and not talking about what it could have been.

Saying "Don't Buy Drugs From People You Don't Know" or 
"Well, Sure You're Sick, BUT It's Not Heroin" isn't going to help
your friend who was really jonesin for something and got something
bad and is now lying in your arms paler than a ghost, sweating
so much that your getting soaked.

So fuck the "dissemination of accurate information" idealist answer,
think about the totally selfish reason that it may happen to someone
you care a lot about.

Don't pull a peter parker, start talking NOW about what
the stuff could actually HAVE been.  Okay, so not much information
was given, but maybe some people on here know the right questions
to ask or just some questions to ask, so we could all be more
informed about what is going on around us.

peace... or annihilation... it's your choice. 

 ,
dana

For 5 grams of crack cocaine, you receive a minimum 5 year sentence without
parole.  For powder cocaine, it takes 500 grams to receive the same sentence.

Hmmm... I wonder which one lawyers and judges do.

Subject: Drugs in Drugs
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com (sfraves@hyperreal.com)
Date: Fri, 26 Apr 96 14:09:01 PDT
From: DWATANAB@UCI.EDU (Dana Watanabe)
X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.3 PL11]
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

I've heard the Heroin thing a LOT, so i'm really wondering
where it comes from...

random story:

A friend of mine took a pill that he thought was MDMA, 
even bought it from someone whom he trusted.  
He hadn't done E before, so he didn't really know what to expect.
People kept saying "Do you want to hug everyone and plant
flowers at their feet?"
He said "Uh.. no, but my hands feel tingly, and my body temperature
is really high, and different surfaces feel fun to rub"
He spent a few hours curled up in a ball, dripping sweat
and just feeling absolutely miserable until things calmed down.
He then was pretty sick (although not close to that bad) for the next
few days.

Being the experimental little pup that he is, he took the second
pill he bought in the hopes that there was just some wierd
reaction the first time.  But the same exact thing
(including the following sickness) happened. 

Many, many, many people said: "That must have been heroin."

(Quite a few people also said "Heroin isn't really orally active,
so that couldn't have been heroin."  but didn't have any
other, better or worse, suggestions.)

Said friend later went into a hospital for a leg injury and was 
prescribed oxycodone for the pain.  He noticed a lot of the same
tingliness, tactile enjoyment and pure misery that he
experienced before.  But didn't experience the same sickness
for days.  Everything else, though, seemed pretty much the same,
just a slightly milder version.

The pills presumed to be MDMA were pressed and had a similar appearance
to the oxycodone he was prescribed.

Don't know the connection, but my completely uneducated/uninformed
little theory was that seeing as how heroin is a narcotic
and oxycodone is an opiod analgesic, there might be a connection there.

Presumably the unknown pills weren't heroin or oxycodone, 
but guessing that it might be someone's codeine prescription
or something like that seemed right.

Just some random thoughts

 ,
dana

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Fri Apr 26 15:00:35 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) id PAA08498; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 15:00:35 -0700
Received: from soda.CSUA.Berkeley.EDU by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.12/8.6.5) with ESMTP id OAA08421; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 14:59:56 -0700
Received: from soda.CSUA.Berkeley.EDU (ausman@localhost) by soda.CSUA.Berkeley.EDU (8.6.12/8.6.12) with ESMTP id OAA01612 for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Fri, 26 Apr 1996 14:59:39 -0700
Message-Id: <199604262159.OAA01612@soda.CSUA.Berkeley.EDU>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: copbaiting (was April 26, Fusion)
Date: Fri, 26 Apr 1996 14:59:21 -0700
From: James Ausman <ausman@CSUA.Berkeley.EDU>
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


Having been involved in the activist community for a long time, I have
run across this sort of thing before. We call it "copbaiting". Do not 
do it. It is _fucked_. If you have evidence (personal evidence, not
a rumor you heard), that is one thing, but to pass along bullshit
rumors just undermines the scene and creates unneccesary paranoia.

It is an old cop tactic, one used with great success in COINTELPRO days,
and the _fear_ of police sting operation is probably far worse than what
the actual thing would be. Think about it: what would happen if the police
were to do such a stupid thing? There would be a great public spotlight
put upon us, and society would see us for the bunch of responsible, loving,
"good citizen" types that we are. It ain't gonna happen. Especially not
in San Francisco, where the DA ran on a "drug laws are the lowest priority"
platform.

Please do not do this.

Peace,
Jim


From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Fri Apr 26 15:23:34 1996

populous areas on skyine further down south.  If we wanted to try Frost
